column3: This project is intended to build a comprehensive system that captures correct and ample measurements data points from mobile clients. Additionally, this project will also support getting Conviva data to Big Data platform.

The DIRECTV addressable advertising platform was launched in 2012, providing our TV advertisers a new and more targeted way to reach viewers. The Addressable Advertising Platform serves both national advertisers with Aggregation and Local Advertisers with Zone Targeted Advertising (“ZTA”). The addressable universe is roughly 13M homes served with both HD and SD DVR’s including the Genie server. • Differentiate DIRECTV Ad Sales to make our platform a must buy • Adopt a data driven approach to provide advertisers with more insights and accountability • Improve the customer experience (Advertisers & Agencies) by making our platform easier to buy, manage and operate. As Addressable campaigns have been executed certain aspects of the Addressable Platform need enhancements to scale the business, resolve certain Advertising Customer and Advertising partner issues. This PRD will establish the most critical asks for 2014. Eventually the Addressable Platform capability should be extended to all advertising product lines, Dynamic Ad Insertion (“DAI”) in DTVEverywhere and DAI for Set Top Box VOD. The Platform will be enriched by other Entertainment based projects such as Genie recommendations, Universal profiles and cross platform recommendations.

Improve the scalability, flexibility and stability of the Addressable workflow by providing enhancements, including: a faster way to enable Attributes, enabling the Addressable targeting of Guide Banners, and expanding the attribute capacity.

column3: This project will replace AMS (Asset Management System) and WFS (Work Flow System), which reached end-of-life in 2014. Both are critical components of the work flow for VOD and are also at capacity, becoming the main bottleneck for new content. Growth beyond 25k titles and adding 4K resolution content will be severely limited as AMS and WFS must be replaced in order to meet future goals. AMS and WFS are also on old hardware, with adult AMS having no backup today. Additionally, both systems are bound to legacy formats and protocols and cannot adapt to future needs.

The APG Re-Architecture involves moving the broadcast guide system (APG-HE) to a modern platform from a variety of hardware and software stacks on which APG-HE is currently running.The new system will run on virtualized hardware, utilize enterprise service buses, a common enterprise database (MySQL) and support centralized configuration capabilities.

The C61KW is DIRECTV’s first Wireless 4K client that can decode live or recorded 4K streams and display on a non-RVU 4K TV. The C61KW will be built with the 802.11ac wireless standard and will decode HEVC/4K streams from a compatible Genie server to support the company’s 4K and Wireless Video strategy for DIRECTV product offerings.

The C61W is a next generation Genie Mini wireless DIRECTV client. The client will use a new reference standard of wireless technology (802.11AC) which provides improved performance over prior standards. This client is targeted to be deployed in conjunction with the HG1X Genie Server which will be the first DIRECTV server to use the 802.11AC wireless technology.

column2: Implement Business Rules in Policy Services
Improved Recording Accuracy and New Show Display
column3: The Improved Recording Accuracy project will utilize the ‘New’ Indicator sent from Gracenote in conjunction with the existing metadata so the STB (Set Top Box) and the Connected STB can correctly record shows/episodes. The APGHE (Advanced Programming Guide Head End) and PDS will receive the First Run Flag and the Derived Original Airdate. Each of the terms can be defined as follows: * First Run Flag – An existing field set by DLS. The First Run Flag represents whether a program/episode is being shown for the first time as “New” on a channel. For example, the first airing of Game of Thrones on HBO East at 6:00pm PST will have the First Run Flag = Y. * Derived Original Airdate– This is the date when the new episode/show first aired by DIRECTV region (DIRECTV US or DIRECTV LA). For example, an episode of Dr. Who will originally air in the UK on 03/01/2015. About a month later, the same episode airs for the first time in the US on 04/01/2015. The Derived Original Airdate would be set as 04/01/2015 as this was the date the first time the episode aired in the US.
column14: http://myteams.directv.com/dtvepi/Improved Recording Accuracy and New Show Display

This project will be to create both a destination ordering page for all premiums and sports packages, and to create a platform to deliver targeted, dynamic messaging within the STB UI. One the ordering page, once can learn more about each product and order instantly with a remote. (CAPEX: 15.076.01)

The DIRECTV iTV Advertising platform was launched in 2004 to provide TV advertisers with a new way to reach and engage their audience. Few updates have been made since then and DIRECTV is losing ad share (Previous clients such as AXE, Hyundai, Red Bull) to MVPD’s and emerging players (i.e. XBOX ad sales growth was 140% year ’11 to ‘12) that provide competitive iTV advertising solutions. Furthermore, there is ever increasing interest in 2 way connectivity to the STB, which enhances advertiser’s ability to effectively target and report on advertising. iTV advertising is advancing by leaps and bounds and advertisers want to be a part of that. HD Video and graphics, broadband delivered features, connected TV apps, multiple On-Demand features, branded experiences utilizing HTML5 and second screen experiences are all advances in the marketplace that our clients are asking for.

LA4 Lab Move project is a relocation and consolidation of lab facilities presently located in LA3, moving to LA4. The major objective of the project includes the consolidation of lab facilities from multiple floors and rooms in LA3 to a single location in LA4 to provide a more efficient, open work space that will encourage collaboration and meet demands of new emerging technologies.
Build the core infrastructure of the Los Angeles Diverse Facility (LADUF) at Bakersfield, including Radio Frequency (RF) Equipment Shelter.

The HD Isilon storage block contains content assets used for HD linear playout via iTX automation. These assets include live events, ad sales, PPV, and Audience network programs. The life cycle of these assets are not controlled by any content management automation, leaving Operations to manually purge these assets on a periodic basis. This project will address this risky, inefficient, and labor-intensive content handling model by creating an application layer, combined with business rules, to manage content life cycles by type. (CAPEX: 15.164.00)

column2: LABC - Ku Antenna Retrofit and Upgrade
column3: The LABC Uplink System was originally commissioned in 1999 with RSI manufactured antennas 1 through 4 with 2 additional systems (5 and 6) commissioned in 2001. The majority of installed electronics, including the antennas themselves and the Klystron power amplifiers, are obsolete and are no longer supported by the original equipment manufacturers. In order to continue to support DBS uplinks, a retrofit and upgrade of antennas and RF systems is required. Two antennas per year can be accommodated. (CAPEX: 15.192.00)

This project increases the content accessible to our customers on DIRECTV.com by adding 50 Live TV Streaming additional national channels. This gives customers the ability to enjoy live content within the home on their personal computer as well as live Out of Home (OOH) streaming on Dot Com, Tablets and Phones. This capability delivers on the DTVE core strategy of bringing more content to more devices and helps mitigate erosion of DIRECTV services to alternative IP based services (i.e. Netflix, Hulu+, etc.). This functionality will also reinforce DIRECTV as the entertainment hub and provide a competitive advantage over other MVPD’s. This project will increase the live streaming channel capacity from 200 to 250. This project will only fund the cost of bringing in 5 National Streaming channels that AT&T carries that DTV currently does not carry via streaming or satellite.

Schedule updates are completed periodically throughout the day. Due to this functionality, last minute schedule updates or one-off corrections are limited and require brute force update functionality. TMS is planning to provide “within minutes” schedule updates and other potential sources of updates (e.g. sports program monitoring, Internet information). Using the new sources of data provided by TMS, a complimentary system will be developed to support these real-time schedule updates. The purpose of this enhancement is to ensure that live events are not cut-off, thus improving the user experience.

column2: Restart and Lookback C3 for Mobile and Dotcom
column3: This project will leverage real-time-encoding (RTE) to 1) allow customers to restart rights-permitting programs on Live Streaming channels when tuning into the program after it has already started, and 2) make rights-permitting programs available as VOD content after the program has aired for the duration of the C3 window. “Restart” is the branded name of the Live Streaming “Start Over” service. “Look Back” is an internal name only for the C3 VOD service, formally referred to as “72 Hour Look Back”. This service will not be branded for customers, and Look Back titles will appear as VOD titles with no special “Look Back” or “C3” visual distinction. Restart and Look Back programs on phones, tables and dotcom will retain Nielsen and comScore tagging.

column2: Search Enhancement and Personalized Discovery Experience
column3: The objective of this project is to enhance search user experience by personalizing the search results. Search engine shall incorporate user behavior attributes collected from the recommendation engine to achieve the objective. The approach for search enhancement and personalization is to factor in the user behavior attributes like favorite genres, favorite actors, moods, tones to provide results which are personalized to a user. Currently user viewing behavior is captured from multiple platforms (STB – AMS/DMS, DOTCOM – Omniture, Mobile/Tablet – Omniture, plus additional purchase and recording behavior-IT and aggregated together at the account/household level.

column3: The Social Aggregation project allows an end user to connect their social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter, etc.) through the Social Media sites API to DIRECTV. EDS will create a new head-end component; PGWS-SA (Program Guide Web Service – Social Aggregation)**, which will be responsible for handling the social network API integration. PGWS-SA will be responsible for facilitating all user social activity from the device UI (for example, “Liking” a particular show from the Web Guide). PGWS-SA will take each user social request and pass that activity to the user’s social account through the social networking API’s.

The UTPS is a critical component of the linear video satellite broadcast infrastructure. It provides encryption, video/audio monitoring, alarm monitoring, and data insertion for every channel that is broadcast over satellite. In addition to these, it also provides compliance so that many different encoder vendors work well with many different STB models. This project is for the purpose of retrofitting end of life systems, ATPS and TPS, that can no longer be replaced or repaired.

Phase 1 (completion planned in late 2013) is in progress. This phase addresses the replacement for the ATPS in MPEG4. Phase 2 addresses the replacement for TPS (MPEG2). Objective is to field test the new UTPS system, commission and deploy the UTPS at 4 uplink facilities, and transition legacy CONUS and Local channels to UTPS.

column2: VIC Published API and Data Validation Framework
column3: The VIC Published API and Data Validation Framework initiative sets to create a framework to monitor EDS web service responses and performance. Its purpose is to validate that data are consistent over various system components. In case of an issue, the system shall send notifications to users with specific information to allow them to diagnose and troubleshoot the issue quickly.

This project aims to improve the overall performance and responsiveness of the DirecTV Voice Search Service and Mobile Application. Content discovery by way of Voice involves many disparate parts and systems which include mobile clients, automatic speech recognition (ASR), natural language understanding (NLU), intent translation, and content search. Each area is a target for improvement and a redesign of the architecture will be outlined to achieve performance gain and efficiency.
